intro: Halenia hieronymi, commonly known as the Malagasy moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, large, white, star-shaped flowers that open at night. The plant has a climbing habit and produces green, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Halenia hieronymi is noted for its unique nocturnal blooming pattern and is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological and horticultural significance.
